# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_angina`
* Variable label: `History of angina`
* Variable description: `history of angina`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | no history of angina
1        | history of angina

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_angina_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed angina`
* Variable description: `The age first told had angina diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_angina` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `some hedimX == 2 into 1`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `h_angina_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_angina == 1, h_angina_age = heaga`
* `if h_angina == 0, h_angina_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, h_angina_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w1$id)
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim02==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim03==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim04==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim05==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim06==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim07==2)] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-9)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina[which(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-8)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w1$heaga[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_angina==1)],"-1=996;-8=998;-9=997")

# Global table
ELSA_ds <- ELSA_ds_w1

```

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim02==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim03==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim04==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim05==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim06==2 | ELSA_w1$hedim07==2,na.rm=T),
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-9),
  sum(ELSA_w1$hedim01==-8)
)
BeforeH <- c(length(ELSA_w1$id)-sum(X),X[1:3])
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("hedimX!=2->0","hedimX==2->1","hedimX==-9->997","hedimX==-8->998")
kable(C)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_angina` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_angina w1 == 1 or some hedimX == 2 into 1`
* `h_angina w1 != 1 and hedia01 == -9 and hedimX == -1 into 997`
* `h_angina w1 != 1 and hedia01 == -8 and hedimX == -1 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `h_angina_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_angina == 1, h_angina_age = HeAga`
* `if h_angina == 0, h_angina_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, h_angina_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

ELSA_w2 <- left_join(ELSA_w2,ELSA_ds,by="id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w2$id)
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w2$id))
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina[which(ELSA_w2$h_angina==1 | ELSA_w2$hedim01==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim02==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim03==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim04==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim05==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim06==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim07==2 | ELSA_w2$hedim08==2)] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina[which((ELSA_w2$h_angina!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w2$h_angina)) & ELSA_w2$hedia01==-9 & ELSA_w2$hedim01==-1)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina[which((ELSA_w2$h_angina!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w2$h_angina)) & ELSA_w2$hedia01==-8 & ELSA_w2$hedim01==-1)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w2$id))
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w2$HeAga[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina==1)],"-1=996;-8=998;-9=997")
ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w2$h_angina_age) & !ELSA_w2$h_angina_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- ELSA_w2$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w2$h_angina_age) & !ELSA_w2$h_angina_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- full_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  row.names(newtib) <- newtib$id
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ELSA_ds_prov <- ELSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ELSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ELSA_ds_prov,ELSA_ds_w2,log_vec=ELSA_ds_w2$id,col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
ELSA_ds_aux <- ELSA_ds[,c(1,3)]
ELSA_ds_aux <- assign_merge(ELSA_ds_aux,ELSA_ds_w2,log_vec=ELSA_ds_w2$id[which(ELSA_ds_w2$h_angina != 999)], col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 4)
ELSA_ds <- ELSA_ds_prov
ELSA_ds$h_angina_age <- ELSA_ds_aux$h_angina_age
rm(ELSA_ds_prov)
rm(ELSA_ds_aux)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_angina` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_angina previous == 1 or hediman == 1 into 1`
* `h_angina previous != -1 and hediman == -9 into 997`
* `h_angina previous != -1 and hediman == -8 into 998`
* `h_angina previous != 1 and hediman == 0 into 0`


To compute `h_angina_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_angina == 1, h_angina_age = heaga`
* `if h_angina == 0, h_angina_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `-1 into 996`
* `otherwise, h_angina_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w5}

ELSA_w5 <- left_join(ELSA_w5,ELSA_ds,by="id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w5 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w5$id)
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w5$id))
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina[which(ELSA_w5$h_angina==1 | ELSA_w5$hediman==1)] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina[which((ELSA_w5$h_angina!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w5$h_angina)) & ELSA_w5$hediman==0)] <- 0
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina[which((ELSA_w5$h_angina!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w5$h_angina)) & ELSA_w5$hediman==-9)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina[which((ELSA_w5$h_angina!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w5$h_angina)) & ELSA_w5$hediman==-8)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w5$id))
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w5$heaga[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina==1)],"-1=996;-2=991;-8=998;-9=997")
ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w5$h_angina_age) & !ELSA_w5$h_angina_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- ELSA_w5$h_angina_age[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w5$h_angina_age) & !ELSA_w5$h_angina_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- full_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  row.names(newtib) <- newtib$id
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ELSA_ds_prov <- ELSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ELSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ELSA_ds_prov,ELSA_ds_w5,log_vec=ELSA_ds_w5$id,col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
ELSA_ds_aux <- ELSA_ds[,c(1,3)]
ELSA_ds_aux <- assign_merge(ELSA_ds_aux,ELSA_ds_w5,log_vec=ELSA_ds_w5$id[which(ELSA_ds_w5$h_angina != 999)], col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 4)
ELSA_ds <- ELSA_ds_prov
ELSA_ds$h_angina_age <- ELSA_ds_aux$h_angina_age
rm(ELSA_ds_prov)
rm(ELSA_ds_aux)

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}

l.hds <- list(w1 = ELSA_ds_w1, w2 = ELSA_ds_w2, w3 = ELSA_ds_w3, w4 = ELSA_ds_w4, w5 = ELSA_ds_w5, w6 = ELSA_ds_w6, w7 = ELSA_ds_w7)

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  label(l.hds[[name]][[3]]) <- label(aux_object[[3]]) <- ds_label_age # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[3]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[3]], labels = cont_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("ELSA_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}

             length(l.hds[[1]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[2]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[3]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[4]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[5]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[6]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[7]][[2]])
             )
names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3", "w4", "w5", "w6", "w7")
kable(t.hds)

dbb <- merge(ELSA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","h_angina")], ELSA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb,ELSA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ELSA_m_ds_w4[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w3",".w4"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb,ELSA_m_ds_w5[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ELSA_m_ds_w6[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w5",".w6"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb,ELSA_m_ds_w7[,c("id","h_angina")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2","w4","w5")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],dbb[,5],dbb[,6],dbb[,7],dbb[,8],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])

```
